channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: Shohei Ohtani to start World Series Game 7 on mound as Dodgers navigate unique MLB rule
item.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers are starting Shohei Ohtani on the mound as they work to navigate a unique rule in Game 7 of the World Series against the Toronto Blue Jays.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Brissett will start third straight game at QB for Cardinals because of Murray's foot injury
item.description: TEMPE, Ariz. (AP) — Veteran backup Jacoby Brissett will start his third straight game at quarterback for the Arizona Cardinals on Monday night while Kyler Murray continues to recover from a lingering foot injury.
item.dc:creator: DAVID BRANDT, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Arsenal wins again to extend lead in the Premier League and Man United salvages late draw
item.description: MANCHESTER, England (AP) — The wins just keep on coming for Arsenal. The Premier League leader extended its advantage at the top of the standings to seven points on Saturday after a 2-0 victory against Burnley.
item.dc:creator: JAMES ROBSON, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Texas QB Manning with 2 early TD throws against No. 9 Vanderbilt after clearing concussion protocol
item.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Texas quarterback Arch Manning started for the No. 20 Longhorns against No. 9 Vanderbilt after clearing concussion protocol and threw two touchdowns in the first half. Texas led 24-10 at halftime.
item.dc:creator: JIM VERTUNO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Shohei Ohtani to start World Series Game 7 for Dodgers against Blue Jays and Max Scherzer
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Shohei Ohtani will start Game 7 of the World Series for the Los Angeles Dodgers against the Toronto Blue Jays, showcasing the two-way star on the mound in the sport's biggest game. Starting Ohtani makes more sense for the Dodgers than using him in relief.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Police launch home burglary investigation at property reportedly connected to Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
item.description: Authorities said thieves broke into a home Thursday. The property has been linked to reigning NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander. The Thunder played the Wizards Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Penn State quarterback listed out for Ohio State game
item.description: (WHTM) — The quarterback situation just got even shakier for the Nittany Lions as they get ready to take on the No. 1 Ohio State Buckeyes on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Hayden Sherry, PHL 17

item.title: Texas QB Manning with 2 early TD throws against No. 9 Vanderbilt after clearing concussion protocol
item.description: Texas quarterback Arch Manning started for the No. 20 Longhorns against No. 9 Vanderbilt after clearing concussion protocol.
item.dc:creator: Jim Vertuno, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Oilers play the Blackhawks after Nurse's 2-goal showing
item.description: The Edmonton Oilers host the Chicago Blackhawks after Darnell Nurse's two-goal game against the New York Rangers in the Oilers' 4-3 overtime loss. Story Chicago Blackhawks (5-4-2, in the Central Division) vs. Edmonton Oilers (5-4-3, in the Pacific Division) Edmonton, Alberta; Saturday, 9 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: What to know before Stanford kicks off against Pitt
item.description: The Cardinal has been perfect at home, but its stout defense faces a big challenge Saturday against the Panthers' breakout freshman quarterback.
item.dc:creator: Harold Gutmann, The Mercury News

item.title: Double trouble: Barger gets caught off second base as Blue Jays' rally fizzles in Game 6 of Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Addison Barger was thinking base hit off the bat — and he was going to score the tying run for Toronto in the ninth inning Friday night. Then, in a flash, he got doubled off second and Game 6 was over. Just like that.
item.dc:creator: ROB GILLIES, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Jazz get burned by the Suns, 118-96
item.description: PHOENIX (ABC4 Sports) - The Utah Jazz fell in an early hole they could not climb out of in a 118-96 loss to the Phoenix Suns Friday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: George Springer drives in Toronto's lone run as he returns for World Series Game 6 against Dodgers
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — George Springer hit an RBI single for the Blue Jays' lone run in Game 6 of the World Series on Friday night, making an impact after missing two games with an injury to his right side in Toronto's 3-1 loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers.
item.dc:creator: ROB GILLIES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Giddey, Vucevic lead Bulls past Knicks 135-125 and a 5-0 start
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Josh Giddey scored a career-high 32 points with 10 rebounds and nine assists, Nikola Vucevic added 26 points, and the Chicago Bulls beat the New York Knicks 135-125 on Friday night to stay undefeated and get out to their best start in nearly three decades.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps: 'We are trying our hardest' to settle antitrust lawsuit
item.description: AVONDALE, Ariz. (AP) — NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps said Friday “we are trying our hardest” to settle the federal antitrust lawsuit with the two teams suing the racing series in the most expansive comments yet from the defendants.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Jaguars' Travis Hunter surprisingly lands on injured reserve; coach noncommittal about return for this season
item.description: Travis Hunter sustained a noncontact knee injury during practice this week, leaving head coach Liam Coen unsure whether he will return this season.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: NFL fines the Baltimore Ravens $100,000 over the inaccurate injury report involving Lamar Jackson
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The Baltimore Ravens have been fined $100,000 by the NFL for incorrectly listing star quarterback Lamar Jackson as a full participant in practice on Oct. 24. The league disclosed the fine for violating the injury report policy Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Gervonta 'Tank' Davis hit with civil suit over domestic allegations at strip club weeks before Jake Paul fight
item.description: Gervonta "Tank" Davis faces a civil lawsuit from ex-girlfriend Courtney Rossel alleging assault at her workplace, just weeks before his exhibition fight against Jake Paul.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Dolphins part ways with general manager Chris Grier amid disastrous season
item.description: The Miami Dolphins and general manager Chris Grier mutually agreed to part ways Friday morning after the team's blowout loss to the Baltimore Ravens on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Lamar Jackson torches Miami with 4 TD passes in return from injury and Ravens rout Dolphins 28-6
item.description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) — Lamar Jackson returned for the Baltimore Ravens, and so did the chants of “M-V-P!” — on the road. Jackson threw for 204 yards and four touchdowns, showing little rust in his return from a right hamstring strain, and the Ravens routed the Miami Dolphins 28-6.
item.dc:creator: ALANIS THAMES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Wembanyama leads Spurs to their first 5-0 start with 27 points and 18 rebounds in win over the Heat
item.description: SAN ANTONIO (AP) — Victor Wembanyama had 27 points, 18 rebounds, six assists and five blocked shots, and the San Antonio Spurs improved to 5-0 for the first time in franchise history by beating the Miami Heat 107-101 on Thursday night.
item.dc:creator: RAUL DOMINGUEZ, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: SDFC wins playoff debut at Snapdragon Stadium, defeats Portland 2-1
item.description: San Diego FC defeated the Portland Timbers 2-1 in Game 1 of the best-of-three first-round series, becoming just the third expansion team in MLS history to win its first playoff game in its inaugural season.
item.dc:creator: Sharisse Cohee, Fox 5

item.title: Bulls beat the cold-shooting Magic 110-98 for a 2-0 start
item.description: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) — Josh Giddey had 21 points and eight rebounds, and the Chicago Bulls beat the Orlando Magic 110-98 on Saturday night for a 2-0 start. Jalen Smith added 16 points for the Bulls, one of their four players off the bench in double figures.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Cooley scores twice as Mammoth win sixth straight, 6-2
item.description: ST. PAUL, Minn. (ABC4 Sports) - Logan Cooley scored twice in the first 3:29, Nick Schmaltz also had two goals and the Utah Mammoth won their sixth straight game, beating the Minnesota Wild 6-2 on Saturday night. Two days after scoring a first-period hat trick at St.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: BYU keeps rolling with 41-27 win at Iowa State
item.description: AMES, Iowa (ABC4 Sports) - There was no letdown after the rivalry game this time. Bear Bachmeier threw for 307 yards and two touchdowns, both to Parker Kingston, as the 11th-ranked Cougars came from 14 points down to beat Iowa State Saturday afternoon, 41-27.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4
